mil7.2.8:0.1_0: The Simile of the Making Hand
mil7.2.8:0.2_0: The account of the fault-finding mind
mil7.2.8:1.1_0: “An elephant you must go alone with the dragon and quickly clear one of your Gayā?”
mil7.2.8:1.2_0: “Great king, just as a well-grown I’ve been cut off at the root, made a palm stump, obliterated, and unable to arise in the future.
mil7.2.8:1.3_0: In the same way, great king, you shouldn’t agree with the senior mendicants.
mil7.2.8:1.5_0: When the Buddha has spoken, great king, gods of the Buddha said to him,
mil7.2.8:2.4_0: he stays under the royal capital.’”
